title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 08 September 2015 - XWiki
content:
<elsanchez\_> I'm using xwiki 7.1.2 , and I have not found anything about this issue.  
00:11 <elsanchez\_> k, I think that I'm leaving this question for the forum or the users mailing list.  
00:22 <Chuguniy> has joined #xwiki  
00:47 <elsanchez\_> has quit  
00:54 <elsanchez\_> has joined #xwiki  
01:06 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
02:01 <woshilapin> has quit  
03:49 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
04:09 <Denis> has quit  
04:13 <cpe> has quit  
04:13 <cpe\_> has joined #xwiki  
04:13 <cpe\_> is now known as <cpe>  
05:19 <elsanchez\_> has quit  
07:03 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
07:19 <Ramona1> has joined #xwiki  
08:12 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:39 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
08:50 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:23 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:28 <woshilapin> has quit  
09:39 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:41 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
10:05 <vmassol> good monring everyone  
10:05 <vmassol> so 17 issues left for RC1 :)  
10:06 <vmassol> 3 days left (keeping 1 day for CI stabilization) => we need to an average of 6 per day (ofc this is a stupid average since not all issues take the same time) :)  
10:07 <vmassol> would still be nice if we could go down to 10-11 at the end of the day  
10:10 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
10:11 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:13 <vmassol> the main risk we have is that we discover a lot more issues for RC1. Yesterday we added around 4-5 issues I think  
10:22 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: good morning, do you have an opinion about http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12327# ?  
10:23 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: better to put it in templates/, no?  
10:23 <gdelhumeau> A)II then  
10:24 <gdelhumeau> I should read all the comments  
10:25 <vmassol> yes you should ready Caty's comments  
10:25 <vmassol> since we already have a place for resources in resources/  
10:25 <tmortagne> vmassol: I think I found partly what is wrong with XWIKI-12487 but it don't know pdf export very well so not sure if we recently changed something in the way we use FOP that would make it loads all the fonts in the system (which I really can't imagine how it could be usefull for an export) instead of using a specific one directly  
10:26 <vmassol> tmortagne: hmm doesn't ring a bell. If a change was made it wasn't voluntarily (at least not from me)  
10:26 <vmassol> (I mean I don't remember chaning the way we use FOP)  
10:27 <vmassol> \*changing  
10:27 <tmortagne> does anyone has any idea what font we are supposed to use when exporting a PDF ? I think we have some open source font embedded in our WAR just for this but not sure  
10:28 <tmortagne> maybe we don't put it in FOP configuration anymore or something like this  
10:29 <tmortagne> maybe trying to understand why FOP is doing this I would need to know what it's supposed to do  
10:33 <tmortagne> or so that's it, if we don't provide a fond by configuration FOP select one in the system (but load all of them in the process)  
10:33 <tmortagne> so I don't know if we are supposed to provide a font but we should really do...  
10:34 <vmassol> yes sergiu had bundled some fonts  
10:35 <vmassol> some related issues that could help maye:  
10:35 <vmassol> \*maybe  
10:35 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-2555  
10:35 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-2578  
10:36 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-2593  
10:36 <vmassol> on http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7106 I see:  
10:37 <vmassol> "PDFs are exported using only FreeFonts, which don't yet provide support for CJK characters. "  
10:37 <vmassol> this seems to indicate we use FreeFonts for exports  
10:40 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: see my last comment  
10:40 <vmassol> I feel this is the only good solution  
10:41 <gdelhumeau> reading it  
10:41 <vmassol> so basically close the issue as won't fix and instead document it  
10:44 <tmortagne> ok so from what I see we indicate FOP where to load fonts by default but according to the log in XWIKI-12487 it does not care  
10:52 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:24 <vmassol> guys, would be nice if you could reply to my last mail about the app best practice, so that I can close one issue more :)  
11:24 <vmassol> thanks!

18:44 <mflorea> vmassol: we have a page Main.Spaces (in enterprise-ui-common). Do we keep it? It doesn't do much, just calls the {{spaces/}} macro  
18:45 <vmassol> strange, I don't recall it, let me check on playground  
18:45 <mflorea> ignore me  
18:45 <mflorea> that's the macro definition page  
18:45 <vmassol> ok  
18:45 <vmassol> indeed  
18:46 <vmassol> still we probably don't need it anymore by default but we could decide later, after 7.2  
18:46 <mflorea> yes, for later
